FAQ READING
settings.subheading: A legit level of responsible adulting

settings.title: üìå First things first
settings.text:
A few of us at Bonsai Bar sat down to update the FAQs and quickly realized... the answer to most of your burning questions is: it depends.

With over 100 venues in the mix, each one has its own vibe‚Äîfrom outdoor beer gardens in New Orleans and swanky spots in New York City to quiet country breweries, and more than one that might just be haunted. When in doubt, check the venue‚Äôs website or reach out to them directly about parking, policies, concessions or any quirks before booking your class.

settings.title: Easy Questions
How often do I water?
settings.text: If you can't find your tree care card it's here on the TREE CARE page. Print a copy for the fridge or tape it to your Bonsai's Pot!

settings.title: How long are your classes?
settings.text: Our classes are 120 minutes long. You are seated for the duration of the class.

settings.title: Why are all of your classes at breweries?
settings.text: üçª Breweries and distilleries have been awesome partners‚Äîturns out, tiny trees and tasty booze are a match made in bonsai heaven. They‚Äôve usually got space to spare and are always down for a good time (and good programming). You‚Äôll also catch us popping up at wineries, cafes, and grills‚Äîbasically anywhere with tables, drinks, and a slight disregard for how messy potting soil can get.

settings.title: Do I have to drink beer?
settings.text: Nope! Even our most typical ‚Äòbrewery‚Äô venues often offer a range of wines, other alcoholic drinks, seltzers, sodas, non-alcoholic & snacks! Many of our venues have full kitchens, so it's a good idea to check the venue‚Äôs website ahead of class. Just don't come hangry. You can't bonsai hangry.

settings.title: Can I bring my own wine?
settings.text: Nope! That is a violation of the venue‚Äôs license and very inappropriate. Please don‚Äôt do that.

settings.title: Do all of your brewery venues have wine?
settings.text: üç∑ Nope! Before locking in your venue, check their website to see what they‚Äôre pouring. Some breweries have full bar licenses and serve wine, cocktails, maybe even a mysterious house-made elixir. Others are strictly beer-and-vibes only. It all depends on the venue‚Äîand the state (the legal kind, not your emotional one). Check before you sip!

settings.title: Is there a beer included in my ticket?
settings.text:
üéüÔ∏è Your ticket covers the important stuff‚Äîlike your very own baby tree and all the tools you need to become its proud plant parent.

Food and drinks? That‚Äôs between you and the venue. Nothing edible is included (unless you‚Äôre really hungry -- Our Dwarf Jade Plants are edible!) Check the venue‚Äôs website to see if they‚Äôve got a food menu, food truck, or just good vibes and pretzels.

settings.title: Should I bring my own bonsai tools?
settings.text:
‚úÇÔ∏è Nope, no need to bring a thing‚Äîwe‚Äôve got you covered, including dangerously satisfying scissors.

Just show up ready to trim tiny trees and feel powerful.

settings.title: Will I get dirty?
settings.text: You will be encouraged to get your hands in the dirt, but you shouldn‚Äôt get anything above the wrist! Nothing you can‚Äôt take care of in the bathroom sink. That said, there will be dirt present at your table, being dug and then cleared away, so maybe don‚Äôt wear anything you aren‚Äôt comfortable taking a risk on.

settings.title: üéß Are your classes loud?
settings.text:
Well, it depends‚Äîsome venues are a little more "Shh, we‚Äôre Zen!" while others are more "Let‚Äôs make Bonsai AND GROOVE BABY!" We do our best to create the ideal learning environment, no matter the decibel level.

And don‚Äôt worry, we‚Äôve got you covered with helpful tools like whiteboards and a digital guide, so whether you‚Äôre a "read it" or "see it" learner, you‚Äôll leave with a tree (and maybe a little less sanity).

settings.title: ‚ôø What if I require special accommodations or class modifications?
settings.text: ‚ôø If you require accommodations or modifications, and you are worried about how this might go at class, please reach out in advance of the class and let us know. We'd love to hear from you.

settings.title: Should I bring a carrier to get my bonsai tree home? What do you recommend?
settings.text: A flat-bottom container (cardboard box) or a flat-bottomed reusable grocery tote that you don‚Äôt mind getting a few stones in. If you're taking public transit home you'll be glad to have a carrier.

settings.title: More complicated questions
Are your classes ok for my 4-year-old?
settings.text: Depends how good your kid is with REALLY SHARP scissors, and if your little wiggler will be able to sit still and be very quiet for 2 hours. If not, we‚Äôd suggest a night out for yourself, and recreating the event at home with our DIY-kit.

settings.title: Are your classes ok for my 17-year-old?
settings.text: Yes! Since our events are ticketed, young adult tree-lovers under 21 are welcome to attend our events! We recommend our workshops for ages 12 and up; our instructors may not use the cleanest language, so bring your (ticketed) young person at your discretion. üôâ

settings.title: Can my partner/roommate and I share a tree?
settings.text: Because our venues give us a limited number of seats (and we can‚Äôt fit a bonsai forest in the room), we require that everyone be ticketed and work on their own tree.

settings.title: Can your class come to ME?
settings.text: Yes! For our private Teambuilder events, we will go almost anywhere you can bring a big group! Offices, community centers, or your own backyard. We love doing Corporate Events and can do these at your workplace. Reach out to learn more, get pricing and our fancy brochure.

settings.title: I'm in my bonsai era. What else do you have?
